Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lip-cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: lip reserved with black band at top; below, black-figure decoration consisting of lion (forepart remaining; added red on mane and tongue, added white on teeth and under belly) to right, with left paw raised, facing a panther to left,with frontal head turned sideways, caught between lion's jaw and raised paw (red dots on neck, two strokes on ribs, one on rump); below, dilute brown band at junction of lip and bowl; two ancient repair holes, one on left, other at bottom right; white deposits inside and outside.
Curator's comments: The registration number 1886,0401.1229 is incorrectly given by Beazley and Payne 1929, 256 no. 11 to a dinos fragment.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.33)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 388, no. B555)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 226, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0572) (Phase 1)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XIII, no. 13)
